Heading: Entry
Heading Text: CBS BUSINESS UNIT: CBS Interactive

Heading: ABOUT US:
Heading Text: CBS Interactive, a division of ViacomCBS, is the world’s largest publisher of premium digital content and a perennial top 10 Internet company. CBS Interactive’s brands span popular categories like technology, entertainment, sports, news and gaming.

Heading: DESCRIPTION:
Heading Text: We have an ongoing hiring need for Business Intelligence Analysts in various locations and are continuously reviewing applicants. All applicants will be reviewed and considered for a current or near-future opening.

Heading: What you’ll do:
Heading Text: As a business intelligence analyst, you’ll lead data-driven analysis projects. The opportunities, barriers, and trends you identify will have a direct influence on business choices and growth strategies within our collective eco-system of web properties, and streaming services. You’ll engage product owners & business stakeholders to gather requirements and work large datasets, querying against multiple databases and/or off-the-shelf analytics packages. Present insights, analyses, and recommendations in a narrative fashion that will be shaping the user experience for millions.

Heading: POSITION SUMMARY:
Heading Text: EcoHealth Alliance seeks a creative, self-motivated, and technically adept Data Librarian/Analyst to support our growing organization’s data management needs related to our research in disease emergence, pandemic prediction and preparedness, and wildlife conservation. The Data Librarian/Analyst will work closely with our teams of scientists, ranging from field veterinarians to machine-learning specialists, as well as software engineers and staff, to maintain best practices for data management and facilitate research across the organization and with collaborators. The Data Librarian/Analyst will support the development of a common set of tools and practices for managing and harmonizing our diverse data (epidemiological, ecological, geospatial, and text) for varied project needs across the organization. This position will require work with researchers at a variety of technical skill levels to improve data management, reuse, interoperability, sharing, publication, real-time reporting and reproducibility. Time will be evenly split between (a) data curation and tooling and (b) providing support to project teams in data acquisition, analysis, and visualization tasks.

Heading: RESPONSIBILITIES:
Heading Text: Reporting to the Principal Scientist for Computational Research, the Data Librarian/Analyst will:

Heading: MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Heading Text: M.S. or Ph.D. in library science, data science, statistics, or relevant experience and a degree in a related quantitative field. B.A. or B.S. candidates with a degree in library science, data science, statistics, or related will be considered with 2+ years of relevant data management experience. Candidates with no degree will be considered with 4+ years of relevant data management experience.

Heading: Strong R programming skills
Heading Text: Knowledge of some or all of EHA’s current data pipeline tools: RStudio Connect, Open Data Kit, AirTable, Git, GitHub, GitHub Actions, Docker

Heading: OTHER PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Heading Text: Analytical experience with ecological, epidemiological, spatial and/or phylogenetic data

Heading Text: Develop standard ETL packages in support of business unit processes and analytics.

Heading: Scope of Responsibilities:
Heading Text: The position serves as an experienced analyst in the use of extract, translate and load (ETL) software in conjunction with programming languages (SQL, C#, VBA, etc.) to move data in support of business unit processes and statistical analysis. It is important for the position to communicate with clear narratives, compelling data visualization and technical precision, both in-person and in writing, to enable recipients to understand the analyses or process flow. The position partners and collaborates with colleagues in related functions, including Compliance, Risk, Treasury, Product and business lines to implement and understand data flows. This role is highly technical in nature and requires demonstrated attention to detail, execution and follow-up on multiple initiatives within Customer Asset Management and across the Bank. The ability to identify, analyze, rationalize and communicate complex business, data and statistical problems and recommend corresponding solutions is a key factor of success in this role.

Heading: Job Description
Heading Text: The New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene's Division of Environmental Health works to prevent and control illness and injury related to environmental and occupational health risk through outreach, education, surveillance and enforcement. With staff of 1,000, the Division covers a broad range of subject matter, including oversight of environmental investigations, leading poisoning, injury prevention, occupational health, food safety, child care, radiation control, recreational and drinking water quality, air quality, climate health, vector control, veterinary public health and pest control. The Bureau of Environmental Surveillance and Policy (BESP) in the Division of Environmental Health at the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) works to inform and improve its mission to ground Health Department programs and policy in science and law to support at healthy and equitable natural, built, and occupational environment for all New Yorkers. We promote environmental health through legal and data-driven program support using innovative methods to track environmental determinants of health with a focus on New Yorkers disproportionately impacted by environmental risk. We share data and research findings to encourage evidence based decision making, and partner with communities in community science and outreach to address stakeholder concerns and empower residents. The Bureau of Environmental Surveillance and Policy request to post for one (1) City Research Scientist (Level I) to provide critical support for development and evaluation of this new initiative and for analysis and reporting for COVID-19 inspection activities.

Heading: Minimum Qual Requirements
Heading Text: 1. For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health.

Heading: Preferred Skills
Heading Text: Experience with databases, including analysis and interpretation of data from large, relational data sets;

Heading Text: The New York Post is searching for a web analyst to turn raw data into real business insights. This person will provide analytics insights and recommendations that span across the entire company, including editorial and business development teams.

Heading: Entry
Heading Text: The Metro Group, Inc., is an established, successful, premier Building Service company founded in 1925. Our services include water treatment, boiler repairs, service and installations, HVAC repairs, water services & testing, regulatory compliance and various other valuable building services. We take pride in the work we do while building long lasting partnerships not only with our clients but most importantly with our employees. We are currently seeking a motivated Junior Information Systems Business Analyst that is looking to establish themselves within a company that values fostering continued career growth. This position will work in Metro Group’s Information Systems Department, defining and analyzing business / technical problems causing real life business challenges. The successful candidate should be a dynamic professional with a “can do attitude” able to adapt and manage a wide range of technical and business responsibilities. Role and Responsibilities (include but not limited to): - Lead technical integrations, write reports, and develop technical documentation for the enhancement of existing web applications - Develop ideas and documentation to help automate manual processes to streamline workload for existing staff - Identify potential opportunities for process improvement and report automation using SSRS, external data sources, and other resources - while executing changes to systems with little to no impact - Manage system integration projects by either integrating systems directly or through vendor management / acting as a liaison with key stakeholders and the development team. - Gather requirements, draft flow charts, create architectural diagrams, iterate on design, facilitate testing, go-live planning and support - Create ad-hoc SSRS reports as requested in a timely and accurate manner for management (prepare and maintain daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports. Migrate legacy reports from R&R to SSRS) - Set and execute biweekly JIRA sprints to further IS team goals - Monitor incoming issues and resolve bug tickets in a timely and accurate manner - Help back-fill for IT when necessary such as troubleshooting technical issues with printers, servers, and user workstations Qualifications and Requirements: - Bachelor's Degree or equivalent from four-year College or technical school, preferably in Information Systems, Business Information Systems, Computer Systems, Information Technology, Computer Science, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering - Data migration experience (minimum 1 year) - System Analysis experience (minimum 1 year) - SQL experience (1 year), specific to SQL Server (a plus) - Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including the ability to create / work with Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP and similar functions. Scripting knowledge in Perl, Python, PHP, Visual Basic and/or Windows batch scripting Preferred Skills (PLUS but NOT required; will TRAIN the right person): - Web Programming experience w/ HTML, CSS, JS - Macros and VBA proficiency Benefits and Perks: - Excellent Benefits package including medical and dental insurance - 401K Retirement Plan including company match - Paid holidays, Paid Personal Time Off - Company-paid life insurance - Extensive on the job training provided with career advancement opportunities The Metro Group, Inc. is an EEOC-compliant employer.

Heading: Entry
Heading Text: It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing !

Heading: Job Summary
Heading Text: The Analytics team at Bread is tasked with navigating and understanding Bread’s vast first and third party data and works closely with management stakeholders across Product, Finance, Engineering, and other departments to ensure that we are making the best data-backed decisions we possibly can. As a key member of our growing team, the Senior Data Analyst reports directly to our Lead Analyst and work on some of the most exciting, cross-functional projects at Bread. The Senior Data Analyst demonstrates a passion for data and prides themselves on the ability to use data to shape decisions around business strategy, product design, and profitability. This role involves: modeling new products and growth opportunities, deep-dive research into consumer conversion and repayment behavior, and revenue and profitability reporting among other responsibilities. As the “data expert” in the room and a key partner to every business team at Bread, the Senior Analyst is involved with both ‘teaching them to fish’ through coaching, reporting, and self-service tools, as well as ‘fishing’ by providing your own analysis and insights. This is an individual contributor role, however, there may be opportunities to manage other analysts as the team grows.

Heading: Essential Job Functions
Heading Text: Collaboration: Supporting company leadership, including the C-suite, to identify the highest ROI projects. (difference) responsible for determining capacity and prioritization for the group and ensuring deadlines are met. Demonstrates effective interpersonal skills when working with internal and external partners.
